Hello, [@V8jester](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136093-v8jester/)

with which mod you get to put the numbers "6062" and the letters "JPL" and the flag in your video HAB 6062 ?

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3a9Q880YnWU?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2016-10-31T12:05:16Z" title="10/31/2016 12:05  PM" data-short="7 yr">October 31, 2016</time> by doudou**

> 
> 
> 4 hours ago, doudou said:
> 
> 
> Hello, [@V8jester](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136093-v8jester/)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> with which mod you get to put the numbers "6062" and the letters "JPL" and the flag in your video HAB 6062 ?
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> 
> <iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3a9Q880YnWU?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>
> 

It's a modified version of **[Nebula Decals](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/91071-025-nebula-space-engineering-decals-update-quality-fix-more/)**

You can add your own custom textures and make tweakscaleable..... Well decals **![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")**

Hello, [@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/)

Is the issue of wheel auto-struts still there? I'm having a problem with my construction rover that seems to be caused by the auto-struts because the wheels refuse to change their position. When I right click a wheel it says Autostrut Locked: Heaviest Part.

I tried to search for a fix and found this post: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/138647-turning-off-the-new-wheel-autostrutting/](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/138647-turning-off-the-new-wheel-autostrutting/) but this solution doesn't work for me.

I also tried reinstalling the mod but nothing changed.

Here's a screenshot of my rover:

![8uAdIfi.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/8uAdIfi.jpg)

Thank you.

> 
>

Auto-struts should be turned off, like so:

[http://imgur.com/a/phxLd](http://imgur.com/a/phxLd)

Also make sure you don't have KJR installed, there were reports of KJR interfering with IR movement.

[@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/) I don't have KJR installed and Autostrut is disabled on all parts, but I can't disable it on the wheels.

[@V8jester](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/136093-v8jester/) can you help us? I have not played KSP properly for quite some time, maybe there is a workaround
Workaround is to place some part between wheels and IR part. You need to trick wheels somehow to autostrut some other part instead of IR.
Hey [@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/) just got home I'll try and take a look before I have to go back out again.

> 
> Workaround is to place some part between wheels and IR part. You need to trick wheels somehow to autostrut some other part instead of IR.

I tried that and it seems to work, but only if you have just a single moving wheel and the part is heavier than all other parts in the craft.![1r7EDVw.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/1r7EDVw.jpg)

With two wheels they seem to autostrut to the other tank, not the one they are connected to.

![xUBawJ3.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/xUBawJ3.jpg)

Bummer..... Anyone ask on the KJR thread yet?
I think wheels and struts are hard coded to auto-strut in stock.
What do you do about landing gear and wheels that automatically autostrut? I can't build my deployable base D:

To get KJR working, you can change

         name="multiPartAttachNodeReinforcement">1

from 1 to 0 in KerbalJointReinforcement/Plugin/PluginData/KerbalJointReinforcement/config.xml

Explanation of all the options in the [readme](https://github.com/ferram4/Kerbal-Joint-Reinforcement).

I got a question. What would I need extra to install to be able to do the stuff that this guy does 

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/videoseries?list=PLQzS5LkBoOIj2C92YfVgsXLhM6EA0hHc1" width="480"></iframe>

He seems to use old legacy IR parts. You can do similar with new part models, crafts would look sligtly diffrerent.Besides those he use some of other mods like <abbr title="Umbra Space Industries (a collection of mods)">USI</abbr> parts, can't recognize all used mods jsut from videos. Most important parts are those from IR and player imagination how to do stuff with it.
hmm I can't seem to find them. I downloaded the 1.2 one a few pages back and even installed some of that other stuff it says but I get nothing in game

Hey [@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/) I cannot for the life of me figure out why KJR hates IR so much right now. So I misunderstood. It's the connection of the last IR component in an assembled arm that appears to be fixed in place. If you stack an extendatron on a Pivitron/ The Pivitron will move just fine. But the moving Collider for the Extendatron will remain locked in it's loaded position...... MuMechToggle and MuMechServo are clearly marked as "Ignore" under the KJR .xml file. No one has apparently picked up on the question of incompatibility with IR yet on the KJR thread. But I guess all we can do is keep tinkering till one of us around here figures it out.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-11-01T23:39:53Z" title="11/01/2016 11:39  PM" data-short="7 yr">November 1, 2016</time> by V8jester**

> 
> 
> 8 hours ago, V8jester said:
> 
> 
> Hey [@Ziw](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/135292-ziw/) I cannot for the life of me figure out why KJR hates IR so much right now. So I misunderstood. It's the connection of the last IR component in an assembled arm that appears to be fixed in place. If you stack an extendatron on a Pivitron/ The Pivitron will move just fine. But the moving Collider for the Extendatron will remain locked in it's loaded position...... MuMechToggle and MuMechServo are clearly marked as "Ignore" under the KJR .xml file. No one has apparently picked up on the question of incompatibility with IR yet on the KJR thread. But I guess all we can do is keep tinkering till one of us around here figures it out.
> 

Proper module name is ModuleIRServo, but all the parts have the MuMechToggle alias still as I recall. I'll try to look at the problem later this week.

It is mentioned in KJR thread, but buried quickly with other posts and left unanswered.  

Might be more visible if someone raise issue on github for KJR.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, Ziw said:
> 
> 
> Proper module name is ModuleIRServo, but all the parts have the MuMechToggle alias still as I recall. I'll try to look at the problem later this week.
> 

That may be it right there. I'll keep tinkering with it as well. If I find an answer I'll post it.

I am not using KJR, but I am having a problem where my lander with deployable airlock works fine on the pad, but on changing scenes, the part attached to the extendatron loads in a different position than it was in the editor. 

Is there some setting related to the discussion above that people would recommend? Is there a known incompatibility with CRASH? I am using the latest version from Ziw with the rework parts.

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/k0yw2uo1oetoflc/duna_lander_airlock locked.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/k0yw2uo1oetoflc/duna_lander_airlock%20locked.png?dl=0)

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/erttk294yf68b5k/duna_lander_airlock_extended.png?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/erttk294yf68b5k/duna_lander_airlock_extended.png?dl=0)

If someone has a workaround for the immediate period, that would be great. Else, I will try to isolate the error. (The log has a lot of other stuff going on from what I believe is an unrelated problem, but is here if it would somehow be useful: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/o8ymrm8jk3eyara/Player_2016_11_02.log?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/o8ymrm8jk3eyara/Player_2016_11_02.log?dl=0))
